oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Nathan S. (Ned) Ring to his mother Sarah Frances M. Ring
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Lt. Nathan S. Ring, 40th F.A., Camp Custer, to his mother in Franklin, Tenn. He says 2 of his men took "French leave" (went AWOL) and if quarantine isn't lifted he will have more. Doesn't think he will make it to Euorpe before the war ends "since old Austria, Bulgaria, and Turkey have thrown up the sponge..." Also mentions politics dominating discussion among local men because Henry Ford was a U.S. Senate candidate that year. Ford, a Democrat, lost to Truman Newberry by just 1.7% of vote.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
